meanings.definition: Pronounced with the tongue against the upper front teeth.
meanings.sent1: Her dentalized pronunciation of the word 'think' was very clear.
meanings.sent2: The dentalized sound of 'th' in 'this' is common in English.
meanings.sent3: The dentalized 's' in 'smile' made the word sound funny.
meanings.sent4: His dentalized accent gave his speech a unique charm.
meanings.sent5: The dentalized 't' in 'water' made it easy to understand.

meanings.definition: Articulated with the tip of the tongue against the upper front teeth.
meanings.sent1: The dentalized 't' in 'tune' was very distinct.
meanings.sent2: She had a dentalized accent that made her speech stand out.
meanings.sent4: His dentalized pronunciation added a touch of elegance to his speech.
meanings.sent5: The dentalized 'n' in 'new' was easy to hear.

meanings.definition: Produced with the tongue touching the upper front teeth.
meanings.sent1: The dentalized 'l' in 'light' was pronounced clearly.
meanings.sent2: The dentalized 's' in 'sun' is a common sound.
meanings.sent4: Her dentalized accent gave her speech a unique quality.
meanings.sent5: The dentalized 'n' in 'now' was easy to hear.
